meanings.definition: Adoptionists: Believers in the doctrine that Jesus was the adopted, not natural, son of God.
meanings.sent1: The adoptionists in the church held firm to their belief in Jesus as the adopted son of God.
meanings.sent2: Many adoptionists study ancient texts to understand their doctrine better.
meanings.sent3: The adoptionists joked that Jesus must have had a 'Welcome to the Family' party in heaven.
meanings.sent4: In their view, Jesus was like an adopted prince, chosen by God to fulfill a special role.
meanings.sent5: The adoptionists' conviction about Jesus being the adopted son of God was unwavering.

meanings.definition: Adoptionists: Followers of the belief that Jesus became the Son of God at his baptism.
meanings.sent1: At the baptism ceremony, the adoptionists believed Jesus was officially declared the Son of God.
meanings.sent2: The adoptionists gathered by the river to witness the momentous event.
meanings.sent3: Some adoptionists playfully suggested that Jesus received a 'Son of God' certificate after his baptism.
meanings.sent4: To the adoptionists, the baptism was like a coronation for Jesus as the Son of God.
meanings.sent5: The adoptionists' faith in Jesus' divine adoption was unshakable.
